[{"element":"menu_content","data":{"id":"introduction_menu_content","name":"introduction_menu_content","label":"Introduction","key":"introduction_menu_content"},"elements":[{"element":"div","data":{"label":"What is Loopar?","key":"what_is_loopar","id":"what-is-loopar","name":"what_is_loopar","background_image":[]},"elements":[{"element":"title","data":{"label":"Title What is Loopar","key":"title_what_is_loopar","text":"What is Loopar?","size":"md","id":"title_what_is_loopar","name":"title_what_is_loopar","background_image":[]},"imageProps":{},"style":{}},{"element":"markdown","data":{"name":"md_what_is_loopar","label":"Markdown What is Loopar","key":"md_what_is_loopar","id":"md_what_is_loopar","value":"Loopar is a **full-stack meta-framework** that enables developers to build complete web applications through a visual drag-and-drop interface, while maintaining full programmatic control when needed. Built on modern technologies like Node.js, React, Vite, and Tailwind CSS, Loopar eliminates the traditional barriers between design and development.

Unlike conventional frameworks that require extensive configuration and boilerplate code, Loopar automates the creation of database models, controllers, views, and API endpoints. You design visually, and Loopar generates production-ready code.
```bash
# Get started in seconds
sudo npx loopar create my-project
```

> The installer handles everything automatically. Once executed, you'll see the complete installation process in your console:
```
Installing Loopar...
✓ Creating project structure
✓ Installing dependencies
✓ Configuring environment
✓ Starting application

Loopar initialized on port: 3000
Continue in your browser to complete installation.
```","background_image":[]},"imageProps":{},"style":{}}],"imageProps":{},"style":{}},{"element":"div","data":{"label":"Why Loopar?","key":"why_loopar","id":"why-loopar","name":"why_loopar","background_image":[]},"elements":[{"element":"title","data":{"label":"Title Why Loopar","key":"title_why_loopar","text":"Why Loopar?","size":"md","id":"title_why_loopar","name":"title_why_loopar","background_image":[]},"imageProps":{},"style":{}},{"element":"markdown","data":{"name":"md_why_loopar","label":"Markdown Why Loopar","key":"md_why_loopar","id":"md_why_loopar","value":"### The Problem with Traditional Development

Building modern web applications typically requires:

- Setting up complex toolchains (bundlers, transpilers, linters)
- Writing repetitive CRUD operations
- Managing database migrations manually
- Integrating multiple frameworks and libraries
- Maintaining separate codebases for frontend and backend

### The Loopar Approach

Loopar provides a **unified development experience** where:

| Traditional Approach | Loopar Approach |
|---------------------|----------------|
| Write database schemas manually | Define entities visually, schemas auto-generated |
| Create API endpoints one by one | REST APIs created automatically for each entity |
| Build UI components from scratch | Drag-and-drop interface with 50+ ready components |
| Configure routing manually | Routes auto-generated based on entity structure |
| Separate frontend/backend workflows | Single unified workflow in the browser |","background_image":[]},"imageProps":{},"style":{}}],"imageProps":{},"style":{}},{"element":"div","data":{"label":"Core Philosophy","key":"core_philosophy","id":"core-philosophy","name":"core_philosophy","background_image":[]},"elements":[{"element":"title","data":{"label":"Title Core Philosophy","key":"title_core_philosophy","text":"Core Philosophy","size":"md","id":"title_core_philosophy","name":"title_core_philosophy","background_image":[]},"imageProps":{},"style":{}},{"element":"markdown","data":{"name":"md_core_philosophy","label":"Markdown Core Philosophy","key":"md_core_philosophy","id":"md_core_philosophy","value":"### Self-Recursive Architecture

Loopar is built on a unique **self-recursive architecture**. The framework uses itself to build and extend itself. Every component in the system—including the core Entity model—is an entity that can be modified, extended, or replaced through the same visual interface used for application development.

This means:

- **Entity** creates and manages other entities (including itself)
- **Builders** (FormBuilder, ControllerBuilder, ViewBuilder) are entities that generate other entities
- The framework can evolve and extend its own capabilities dynamically

> Navigate to `desk/entity/list` to see how even the core Entity model exists as a self-referential record.

### No-Code Meets Full-Code

Loopar doesn't force you to choose between visual development and traditional coding:

- **No-Code Mode**: Build entire applications using the visual designer—perfect for rapid prototyping, MVPs, or non-technical team members
- **Low-Code Mode**: Extend visual components with custom logic, hooks, and event handlers
- **Full-Code Mode**: Write custom React components, server-side logic, and database queries when you need complete control

All three modes work together seamlessly in the same project.","background_image":[]},"imageProps":{},"style":{}}],"imageProps":{},"style":{}},{"element":"div","data":{"label":"Key Features","key":"key_features","id":"key-features","name":"key_features","background_image":[]},"elements":[{"element":"title","data":{"label":"Title Key Features","key":"title_key_features","text":"Key Features","size":"md","id":"title_key_features","name":"title_key_features","background_image":[]},"imageProps":{},"style":{}},{"element":"markdown","data":{"name":"md_key_features","label":"Markdown Key Features","key":"md_key_features","id":"md_key_features","value":"### Visual Development Environment

- **Drag-and-Drop Designer**: Build interfaces by dragging components onto a canvas
- **Real-Time Preview**: See changes instantly as you design
- **Component Library**: 50+ pre-built components (forms, tables, charts, layouts)
- **Responsive Design**: Built-in responsive controls for all screen sizes

### Automatic Code Generation

- **Database Models**: Define fields visually, get Sequelize models automatically
- **REST APIs**: Full CRUD endpoints generated for every entity
- **Controllers**: Server-side logic scaffolded and ready for customization
- **Views**: React components generated from your visual designs

### Multi-Tenant Architecture

- **Isolated Databases**: Each tenant can have its own database instance
- **Shared Codebase**: Single deployment serves multiple tenants
- **Custom Domains**: Each tenant can use their own domain
- **Tenant-Specific Configuration**: Override settings per tenant

### App System

- **Modular Applications**: Package functionality into installable apps
- **App Marketplace**: Share and distribute apps within the Loopar ecosystem
- **Dependency Management**: Apps can depend on and extend other apps
- **Version Control**: Track and manage app versions","background_image":[]},"imageProps":{},"style":{}}],"imageProps":{},"style":{}},{"element":"div","data":{"label":"Technology Stack","key":"technology_stack","id":"technology-stack","name":"technology_stack","background_image":[]},"elements":[{"element":"title","data":{"label":"Title Technology Stack","key":"title_technology_stack","text":"Technology Stack","size":"md","id":"title_technology_stack","name":"title_technology_stack","background_image":[]},"imageProps":{},"style":{}},{"element":"subtitle","data":{"label":"Subtitle1","name":"subtitle1_el24893011483","text":"Loopar leverages modern, battle-tested technologies:","animation_duration":1000,"id":"subtitle1_el24893011483","key":"subtitle1_el24893011483"},"imageProps":{},"style":{}},{"element":"row","data":{"label":"Row1","key":"row1_el72983246466","id":"row1_el72983246466","name":"row1_el72983246466","layout":"[50,50]"},"elements":[{"element":"col","data":{"key":"mybtr3nso","id":"mybtr3nso","name":"mybtr3nso","label":"Mybtr3nso"},"elements":[{"element":"markdown","data":{"label":"Markdown2","key":"markdown2_el167773978016","id":"markdown2_el167773978016","name":"markdown2_el167773978016","value":"### Frontend

| Aspect | No-Code Platforms | Loopar |
|--------|-------------------|--------|
| Code Access | Limited or none | Full access to generated code |
| Self-Hosting | Usually not possible | Full control over deployment |
| Vendor Lock-in | High | None—it's open source |
| Customization | Platform limitations | Unlimited with custom code |
